meanings.definition: To prick or urge on with a rowel.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy roweled his horse to make it go faster.
meanings.sent2: She roweled the stubborn mule to move along the dusty trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel roweled the sleepy cat for fun.
meanings.sent4: His words roweled her determination to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The coach roweled the team to victory with his inspiring speech.

meanings.sent1: The spurs roweled loudly as he walked across the wooden floor.
meanings.sent2: Her boots roweled with shiny rowels that caught the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The jingling rowels on his boots roweled the attention of everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The roweled boots added a touch of cowboy charm to his outfit.
meanings.sent5: The roweled spurs completed his western look perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The roweled boots gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the roweled spurs.
meanings.sent3: The roweled cowboy hat completed his rodeo outfit.
meanings.sent4: The roweled belt buckle added a touch of western flair to his attire.
meanings.sent5: The roweled accessories gave him a rugged cowboy look.
